purpose: The code appears to be collecting system information and sending it to external servers for tracking purposes. It retrieves IP address, system details, and package information to a third-party server.
anomalies: Use of hardcoded IP address lookup endpoint
Sending sensitive system information to external servers
Use of http instead of https for requests
Disabling SSL certificate validation with rejectUnauthorized: false
analysis: This code performs unauthorized data exfiltration by collecting system information including IP address, hostname, username, home directory, and package name, then sending this data to three external domains. The code uses HTTP requests without proper SSL verification, which makes it vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks. Additionally, it appears to be part of a malicious package that tracks user environments.
